subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* There is regional variation in the stroke order of the character:
** In [[mainland China]], [[Japan]] and [[Hong Kong]], the sixth stroke is 豎折折.
** In [[Taiwan]], the sixth stroke is 豎折 and the seventh stroke is 豎.
** In [[Japan]] and [[Hong Kong]], the twelfth  stroke is 橫 and the thirteenth stroke is 豎.
** In [[mainland China]], the twelfth  stroke is 橫折, corresponding to the thirteenth stroke in [[Taiwan]].

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|かなえ|yomi=kun}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かなえ|金|tr1=kana|t1=metal|瓮|tr2=he|t2=a pot or pan for holding food or beverages}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Idioms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|鼎の軽重を問う|かなえ の けいじゅう を とう}}: "to ask about the weight of a kettle" ⇒ to [[question]] a person's [[ability]]
* {{ja-r|鼎の沸くが如し|かなえ の わく が ごとし}}: "just like a boiling kettle" ⇒ a metaphor for a noisy busy situation
* {{ja-r|鼎の中の一切れの肉|かなえ の なか の ひときれ の にく}}: "single slice of meat [from] in the kettle" ⇒ to get a read on the whole from a small sample
* {{ja-r|鼎を扛ぐ|かなえ を あぐ}}: "to lift a kettle" ⇒ to be physically strong
* {{ja-r|鼎を定む|かなえ を さだむ}}: "to settle the kettle" ⇒ to control the imperial capital, to ascend the throne

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|てい|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=てい}} {{ltc-l|鼎}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|鼎|tr=dǐng}}.
